inputFields.description: The name of the customer.

inputFields.description: The ID of the payment intent to confirm 3DS for.

inputFields.description: The setup token ID of the payment method to create (used for PayPal).

inputFields.name: state

inputFields.name: accessPassId
inputFields.description: The access pass the plan is related to.

inputFields.name: achPayments
inputFields.description: Whether or not ACH payments are accepted

inputFields.name: allowMultipleQuantity
inputFields.description: Marks whether customers can purchase multiple quantity of the plan.

inputFields.name: baseCurrency
inputFields.description: The respective currency identifier for the plan.

inputFields.name: billingPeriod
inputFields.description: The interval at which the plan charges (renewal plans).

inputFields.name: cancelCollabPasses
inputFields.description: Whether or not to cancel dependant collab passes if a user loses access to this one.

inputFields.name: cancelDiscountIntervals
inputFields.description: Either forever (0), first payment (1), or a specified number of months (2, 3, 4...).

inputFields.name: cancelDiscountPercentage
inputFields.description: The percentage discount to offer when canceling a subscription.

inputFields.name: cardPayments
inputFields.description: Whether or not card payments are accepted

inputFields.name: coinbaseCommerceAccepted
inputFields.description: Marks whether coinbase commerce payments are/aren't accepted.

inputFields.name: customFields
inputFields.description: An array of custom field objects.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the plan.

inputFields.name: expirationDays
inputFields.description: The interval at which the plan charges (expiration plans).

inputFields.name: gracePeriodDays
inputFields.description: The time period (in days) after a sub expires where the customer can still top-up.

inputFields.name: initialPrice
inputFields.description: An additional amount charged upon first purchase.

inputFields.name: internalNotes
inputFields.description: A personal description or notes section for the business.

inputFields.name: mimicPlanId
inputFields.description: The plan to mimic the Stripe Price ID for.

inputFields.name: offerCancelDiscount
inputFields.description: Whether or not to offer a discount to cancel a subscription.

inputFields.name: onePerCompany
inputFields.description: Marks whether or not a plan can be purchased multiple times by a company. Used most likely for free trial plans

inputFields.name: onePerUser
inputFields.description: Marks whether or not a plan can be purchased multiple times by a user. Used most likely for free trial plans

inputFields.name: overrideTaxType
inputFields.description: An override for tax to specify for this specific plan.

inputFields.name: paymentLinkDescription
inputFields.description: The description of the Plan as seen by the customer on the checkout page.

inputFields.name: paypalAccepted
inputFields.description: Marks whether paypal payments are/aren't accepted.

inputFields.name: planType
inputFields.description: Indicates if the plan is a one time payment or recurring.

inputFields.name: redirectUrl
inputFields.description: The URL to redirect the customer to after purchase.

inputFields.name: refillable
inputFields.description: Marks whether an expiration plan can/can't be topped-up.

inputFields.name: releaseMethod
inputFields.description: This is the release method the business uses to sell this plan.

inputFields.name: releaseMethodSettings
inputFields.description: Configurable settings on how this plan is released.

inputFields.name: renewalPrice
inputFields.description: The amount the customer is charged every billing period.

inputFields.name: requirements
inputFields.description: The requirements for the plan.

inputFields.name: setAsDefault
inputFields.description: Whether or not to set this plan as the default for the company.

inputFields.name: shortLink
inputFields.description: The short link identifier for the plan.

inputFields.name: splitPayRequiredPayments
inputFields.description: The number of payments required before pausing the subscription.

inputFields.name: splititAccepted
inputFields.description: Marks whether payments using splitit, a payment processor, are/aren't accepted for the plan.

inputFields.name: stock
inputFields.description: The number of units available for purchase.

inputFields.name: trialPeriodDays
inputFields.description: The number of free trial days added before a renewal plan.

inputFields.name: unlimitedStock
inputFields.description: Limits/doesn't limit the number of units available for purchase.

inputFields.name: visibility
inputFields.description: Shows or hides the plan from public/business view.

inputFields.description: Restricts promo use to only users who have never purchased from the company before.

types.name: PublicPlan
types.description: An object representing a (sanitized) plan of an access pass.

fields.name: acceptedPaymentMethods
fields.description: An array of the accepted payment methods for a plan.

fields.name: accessPass
fields.description: The access pass for the plan.

fields.name: achPayments
fields.description: Whether or not ACH payments are allowed.

fields.name: allowMultipleQuantity
fields.description: Marks whether customers can purchase multiple quantity of the plan.

fields.name: alreadyEntered
fields.description: Marks whether the customer has already purchased this plan.

fields.name: alreadyOwned
fields.description: Returns true if the customer has already purchased this plan and their membership on the plan is currently active.

fields.name: amountSaved
fields.description: No longer used.

fields.name: appleIapPrice
fields.description: Returns the Apple IAP price for the plan, if applicable.

fields.name: baseCurrency
fields.description: The respective currency identifier for the plan.

fields.name: billingPeriod
fields.description: The interval at which the plan charges (renewal plans).

fields.name: billingSetupRequired
fields.description: Whether or not the user has a billing setup for this plan

fields.name: buyButtonLocation
fields.description: Where the user should be re-directed to when clicking the buy box button.

fields.name: buyButtonText
fields.description: The text to display on the buy box.

fields.name: buyerFeeMode
fields.description: How the buyer fee should be applied, if any.

fields.name: buyerFeePercentage
fields.description: The buyer fee percentage to apply to the transaction, if any.

fields.name: buyerFeeSupportedProcessors
fields.description: The payment processors that support the buyer fee, if any.

fields.name: cardPayments
fields.description: Whether the plan supports card payments.

fields.name: checkoutDescription
fields.description: The description to display on the checkout page.

fields.name: checkoutTitle
fields.description: The title to display on the checkout page.

fields.name: checkoutUpsellPlans
fields.description: An array of plans that are upsells for this plan.

args.name: upsellType
args.description: The upsell_type of the upsell plans to return.

fields.name: coinbaseCommerceAccepted
fields.description: Marks whether coinbase commerce payments are/aren't accepted.

fields.name: collectTax
fields.description: Whether or not the plan collects tax.

fields.name: company
fields.description: The company for the plan.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the plan was created.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: The custom fields for the plan.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the plan.

fields.name: directLink
fields.description: The direct link to purchase the access pass.

fields.name: expirationDays
fields.description: The interval at which the plan charges (expiration plans).

fields.name: extraFee
fields.description: The price on top of the `renewal` that the user has to pay. (Used for display on the buy box)

fields.name: formattedAccessPeriod
fields.description: The period the access pass is valid for upon purchase (one-time plans).

fields.name: formattedAmount
fields.description: The amount with the currency that this plan costs.

types.name: Stats
types.description: A list of all queryable stats.

fields.name: statsChurnRate
fields.description: Churn Rate measures the percentage of users who churned (stopped renewing their subscription) in a given period. It is calculated by dividing the number of churned users by the total number of users with an active subscription in the period.

fields.name: statsChurnedUsers
fields.description: Total number of users with an active subscription in a given period that did not renew it in the next period

fields.name: statsConversionRate
fields.description: Conversion Rate

fields.name: statsConversions
fields.description: Total number of conversions

fields.name: statsNewUsers
fields.description: Total number of new users that started a subscription in your whop

fields.name: statsPaidConversionRate
fields.description: Conversion Rate on paid plans

fields.name: statsPaidConversions
fields.description: Total number of paid conversions

fields.name: statsPaidStorepageViews
fields.description: Total number of storepage views with paid plans available

fields.name: statsQuickRatio
fields.description: Quick Ratio measures user growth by dividing new and returning users by churned users. A ratio above 1 indicates net user growth (gaining more users than losing), while below 1 indicates net user loss (losing more users than gaining).

fields.name: statsRetainedUsers
fields.description: Total number of users with an active subscription in a given period that were retained in the next period

fields.name: statsStorepageViews
fields.description: Total number of storepage views

fields.name: statsTimeSpent
fields.description: Total time spent by users in your whop

fields.name: statsTotalEarnings
fields.description: Final net earnings after deducting credit card processing fees, marketplace fees, money paid to affiliates, fees for opened disputes, money lost in disputes, money withheld to pay sales tax if applicable, and money refunded to customers.

fields.name: statsUsersWithTimeSpent
fields.description: Total number of users that spent time in your whop

fields.name: statsWonBackUsers
fields.description: Total number of users with an active subscription in the past that came back after churning

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Requires that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
